Class MonteCarlo

  • java.lang.Object
    • MonteCarlo

  • public final class MonteCarlo
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class containing tools to cyclize a linear Catalyst.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double BOND_LENGTH
      Desired bond length for forming bond
      static int ITERATIONS
      Number of iterations; we always use this many.
      static double KT
      Initial temperature.

    • Method Detail

      • cyclize

        public static Molecule cyclize(Molecule m,
               java.util.List<IndexTorsion> rotatableBonds,
               int leftIndex,
               int rightIndex)
        A molecule cyclizer. Given a molecule and a list of rotatable bonds, the method will make mutations to cyclize the endpoints to a normal bond length. The return will be a new molecule, but with the same indices.
        Parameters:
        m - the molecule to run this algorithm on
        rotatableBonds - the torsions that we can mutate
        leftIndex - the left side of the forming bond
        rightIndex -
        Returns:
        a cyclized molecule; the new bond is not formed!

      • angleModulus

        public static double angleModulus(double d)
        Takes an angle and restricts it to the range [-180.0, 180.0] using the modulus.
        Parameters:
        d - an angle
        Returns:
        the restricted angle

      • decider

        private static boolean decider(double deltaE,
              double temperature)
        Decides whether to mutate. Given a deltaE difference in energy and given temperature, it will return a Boltzmann distribution of true and false for unfavorable changes, true for favorable changes.

      • mutate

        private static Molecule mutate(Molecule m,
              java.util.List<IndexTorsion> rotatableBonds,
              double temperature)
        Mutation engine. For each IndexTorsion, makes a random mutation of up to twenty degrees initially, but this amount gets smaller as the temperature decreases.
